messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]Shirley Temple (was Unschooling not working??)
messages.msgSnippet: http://encarta.msn.com/index/conciseindex/4E/04EBD000.htm?z=1&pg=2&br=1 . In 1967 she ran, unsuccessfully, as a Republican candidate for the Congress of the
messages.messageBody:
http://encarta.msn.com/index/conciseindex/4E/04EBD000.htm?z=1&pg=2&br=1

." In 1967 she ran, unsuccessfully, as a Republican candidate for the
Congress of the United States. Temple was a member of the U.S. delegation to
the United Nations (1969-1970), was U.S. ambassador to Ghana (1974-1976),
and became the first woman in U.S. history to serve as chief of protocol
(1976-1977), during the administration of President Gerald R. Ford. She
served as ambassador to Czechoslovakia (1989-1992), during the
administration of President George Bush.


----- Original Message -----
From: "Nanci Kuykendall" <aisliin@...>
To: <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 04, 2002 11:46 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning]Shirley Temple (was Unschooling not working??)

>
> I think Shirley Temple is a great success story of an
> "America's Sweetheart" child actor who did not get
> chewed up and spit out by Hollywood to end a burned
> out and tragic adult. She instead went on to be an
> American Ambassador to (anyone know which country?
> France?)
>
> Nanci K.

messages.msgSnippet: ... I think Shirley Temple is a great success story of an America s Sweetheart child actor who did not get chewed up and spit out by Hollywood to end a
messages.messageBody:
>Speaking of TV, Tamzin's really into classics at the
>moment.... She is obsessed with Shirley Temple at the
>moment.
>Meghan :-)

I think Shirley Temple is a great success story of an
"America's Sweetheart" child actor who did not get
chewed up and spit out by Hollywood to end a burned
out and tragic adult. She instead went on to be an
American Ambassador to (anyone know which country?
France?)

Nanci K.
